alert.note: Alert for Butler; Greene; Montgomery; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 3:11PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN BUTLER, WARREN, SOUTHWESTERN GREENE AND SOUTH CENTRAL MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 310 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Monroe, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Middletown, Mason, Lebanon, Springboro, Monroe, Franklin, Bellbrook, Carlisle, South Middletown, West Chester, Waynesville, Morrow, Kings Island, Olde West Chester, Four Bridges, Hunter, Wetherington, South Lebanon, Maineville and Corwin. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 22 and 40. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 21 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
